$AMZN AWS is now a $132B ARR business growing 20% the fastest pace since 2022.

With 3.8 gigawatts of new capacity coming online the king of compute is back leading the AI infrastructure cycle.

During the dotcom bubble, 97% of Americaâ€™s fiber was dark because infrastructure was built years ahead of demand.

Todayâ€™s AI buildout looks nothing like that. The comment â€œthere are no dark GPUsâ€ means every GPU produced is already reserved or monetized the moment it ships.

This is the difference between speculative infrastructure & fully utilized infrastructure.

$NVDA will supply over 260K AI chips to Samsung, Hyundai & SK Group under a South Korean government-backed deal. 

Samsung will build an AI facility and supply HBM4 memory, Hyundai will deploy Blackwell for manufacturing and autonomy & SK will launch an AI cloud for industrial use.

$AMZN expects to double capacity by 2027.

Thatâ€™s a straight read-through for $NBIS, $IREN, $CIFR, $GLXY & $CRWV since these are the true AI utilities selling GPU power by the hour.

$AMZN now pulls in over $65B a year from advertising.

$GOOGL monetizes search and $META monetizes attention but both are upstream.

Amazon monetizes intent at the point of conversion, the layer AI agents will optimize most aggressively.

Daily Market Brief:
northmantrader.com/2025/10/3â€¦

As highlighted on the chart below, the 10-year yield has been in a down channel since hitting 4.62% on May 22.

If Gross is correct (repost below) and the 10-year yield rises to 4.25% in the short-term, it will exceed its 4.20% "lower high" in late September and mark the first "higher high" in six months.

Should a "higher high" happen, that would mean the highlighted downtrend ended on October 17 at 3.93%.

As I write, the 10-year is trading at 4.09%, up 11 basis points from yesterday afternoon and 11 basis points from a "higher high." So, halfway there in less than one day.

How many days does it take to reach another trillion dollars?

Oracle $ORCL, OpenAI and Related Digital are planning a >1GW data center in Michigan as part of Stargate, with construction set to begin in early 2026. 

$MSFT $NVDA

Cloud service provider capex is projected to surpass $420 billion in 2025 and increase 24% to over $520 billion in 2026 as Nvidiaâ€™s $NVDA GB300 ramps with Rubin on deck for later in the year.

$MSFT $AMZN $GOOG $ORCL

Cloudflare $NET reported $562 million in revenue in Q3, reaccelerating to 30.7% growth, its highest growth in seven quarters.

Q4 revenue was guided to be $589 million at midpoint, up 28.1% YoY.

Apple $AAPL reported revenue up 7.9% to $102.47 billion, with EPS of $1.85, both beating estimates.

iPhone revenue rose 6.1% YoY to $49.03 billion, while Services revenue reaccelerated to 15.1% YoY to $28.75 billion, its fastest growth since fiscal Q1 2024.

Nvidia $NVDA is said to be investing up to $1 billion in AI startup Poolside, which would quadruple its valuation to $12 billion in the $2 billion round.

Nvidia's investment would reportedly start at $500M and scale to $1B if Poolside reaches its fundraising targets.

Amazon CEO Andy Jassy: 

"We continue to see strong demand in AI and core infrastructure, and weâ€™ve been focused on accelerating capacity â€“ adding more than 3.8 gigawatts in the past 12 months."

$AMZN $MSFT $GOOG $NVDA $ORCL

Amazon $AMZN reported Q3 revenue up 13% to $180.2 billion, beating estimates for $177.7 billion, while EPS of $1.95 beat estimates for $1.57, including a $9.5B gain on its Anthropic stake.

AWS revenue rose 20% to $33.0 billion, beating estimates for 18% growth to $32.4 billion.

$GOOG $MSFT

This may be the most extraordinary - and misunderstood - market environment in decades. 

Economists estimate that just 18% of the economy is expanding, down from 40% six weeks ago, yet GDP expansion is being largely driven by accelerating AI spending.

$AAPL CEO TIM COOK: 

Q1'26 REVENUE TO BE BEST EVER FOR COMPANY AND IPHONE

$AMZN CEO:

AWS is growing at a pace we haven't seen since 2022. Reaccelerating to 20.2% YoY. Our largest growth rate in 11 quarters. It's worth remembering that YoY% growth is a relative term. It's very different. Having 20% YoY growth on a $132B ARR, & to have a higher % growth rate on a meaningfully smaller annual revenue, which is the case with our competitors. 

Backlog grew to $200 billion by Q3 quarter end and doesn't include several unannounced new deals. In October, which together are more than our total deal volume for all of Q3.

Amazon $AMZN CEO:

Our AI-powered shopping assistant Rufus has had 250M active customers this year, with monthly users up 140% YoY, interactions up 210% & users are 60% more likely to complete a purchase. Rufus is on track to drive over $10B in incremental annualized sales.
